summary: The UK government is actively engaging with stakeholders on AI regulation following the closure of a formal consultation period on June 21, 2023. The National AI Strategy emphasizes a pro-innovation approach to governing AI, aiming to create a regulatory framework that is proportionate and future-proof. AI is identified as a critical technology in the UK Science and Technology Framework, which outlines a vision for the UK to become a science and technology superpower by 2030. The government believes that effective regulation will foster innovation, investment, and public trust in AI, ultimately strengthening the UK's position as a global leader in this field.
takeaways: The formal consultation on AI regulation closed on June 21, 2023, but stakeholder engagement continues.
The National AI Strategy aims to develop a pro-innovation framework for AI governance.
AI is recognized as one of five critical technologies in the UK Science and Technology Framework.
The government seeks to create an environment conducive to AI development and public trust.
The regulatory approach is intended to drive growth and establish the UK as a leader in AI.
